intro: Lycianthes heteroclita var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender bitterleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, lobed leaves, and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are typically green berries that turn red when ripe, containing several seeds. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
